definition[0]: to try to persuade people to support a political party, politician, plan etc by going to see them and talking to them, especially when you want them to vote for you in an election
example[0]: Candidates from all three parties were out canvassing in Darlington today.
example[1]: The US has been canvassing support from other Asian states.
example[2]: Chapman spent the rest of May canvassing for votes.
definition[1]: to ask people about something in order to get their opinion or to get information
example[3]: Police canvassed the neighborhood, but didn’t find any witnesses.
definition[2]: to talk about a problem, suggestion etc in detail
example[4]: A committee was set up to canvass the city’s educational options.
example[5]: People were canvassed for their opinions on the scheme.
definition[3]: to try to persuade people to support someone or something
example[6]: The US has been canvassing support from other Asian countries.
